title: ji31
author: ji31
content: Hi All,Rey Capitalpty....Stay away from this BTC investment company. I have had nothing but issues with them from day 1.I did a partnership account and got to the point i wanted to withdraw $8,000 and got a reply from support that i need to pay $5,000..yeah..right.I had an initial investment of $3,500 USD.I would like too know if anybody else has any experience with this company?https://reycapitalpty.com/

comments.author: logfiles
comments.body: Quote from: ji31 on September 04, 2022, 09:37:55 PMHi All,Rey Capitalpty....Stay away from this BTC investment company. I have had nothing but issues with them from day 1.I did a partnership account and got to the point i wanted to withdraw $8,000 and got a reply from support that i need to pay $5,000..yeah..right.I had an initial investment of $3,500 USD.I would like too know if anybody else has any experience with this company?https://reycapitalpty.com/it's a common scam. Don't send them any more money. I am wondering how you ended up with the scam "investment" company. Did any random stranger suggest it to you on social media?Read more reviews here; https://www.beermoneyforum.com/threads/reycapitalpty-com-reviews-scam-or-legit.221008/

comments.author: BitcoinGirl.Club
comments.body: Quote from: ji31 on September 04, 2022, 09:37:55 PMHi All,Rey Capitalpty....Stay away from this BTC investment company. I have had nothing but issues with them from day 1.I did a partnership account and got to the point i wanted to withdraw $8,000 and got a reply from support that i need to pay $5,000..yeah..right.I had an initial investment of $3,500 USD.I would like too know if anybody else has any experience with this company?https://reycapitalpty.com/Sorry if you really invested anything on this scam. Just visited the site and checked the logo. Really it was worthy to invest $3,500 USD? I have no idea what pitch they had for you that you were convinced and gave them $3,500 USD. Please don't tell me that it was the ROI they displayed after x days?Quote91 Wimpole Street, London, England, W1G 0EF You can buy this kind of postcode for Â£20https://find-and-update.company-information.service.gov.uk/company/09308056/officersFind Sibeesh SIDHARTHAN and Neema SIDHARTHAN.You may find them in Southall LOL

comments.author: SFR10
comments.body: Quote from: ji31 on September 04, 2022, 09:37:55 PMand got a reply from support that i need to pay $5,000..yeah..right.You should've had that kind of attitude as soon as you saw the too good to be true returns + a simple background check on its creation date would've saved you from feeding them 3.5K [they're claiming they've been running their operations for the past "1,055 days (more than two and a half years)" but that "isn't the case"]!While we're at it, I'm going to post a bunch of "fake" websites with somewhat similar content and slightly different themes: capitalhush.com, royalcoinex.com, instantcapitalbase.com and kuludaxfinance.com.Quote from: ji31 on September 04, 2022, 09:37:55 PMI had an initial investment of $3,500 USD.Do you mind posting the transaction link [it might come in handy for connecting the dots]?- Only do it if you're fine with exposing your own address!

I am wondering how you ended up with the scam "investment" company. Did any random stranger suggest it to you on social media?Read more reviews here; https://www.beermoneyforum.com/threads/reycapitalpty-com-reviews-scam-or-legit.221008/Link doesnt seem to work.

comments.author: ji31
comments.body: Quote from: ji31 on September 04, 2022, 09:37:55 PMHi All,Rey Capitalpty....Stay away from this BTC investment company. I have had nothing but issues with them from day 1.I did a partnership account and got to the point i wanted to withdraw $8,000 and got a reply from support that i need to pay $5,000..yeah..right.I had an initial investment of $3,500 USD.I would like too know if anybody else has any experience with this company?https://reycapitalpty.com/I have no issue chalking up the $3500 loss.My goal is to expose them as much as possible.In reality i lost $1880. The rest was a quick flip on some tokens.

comments.author: Potato Chips
comments.body: Quote from: ji31 on September 05, 2022, 05:52:47 PMMy goal is to expose them as much as possible.Here are additional communities that may help you for that1. Forums: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5264359.0#post_point612. Subreddits: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5264359.0#post_point153. and this list bitcoin wiki: https://en.bitcoin.it/wiki/Bitcoin_Wiki:Community_portalQuote from: ji31 on September 05, 2022, 05:40:37 PMFrom my BTC wallet to Reycap?I believe so. They probably asked because in some instances, it's possible to know if your money went to a known centralized exchange.Another possible recovery method is to see if your case is tax deductible, see this guide for instance: https://koinly.io/guides/. You'd most likely need a CPA to be extra sure so if hiring one would cost more, nevermind then lol.

You'd most likely need a CPA to be extra sure so if hiring one would cost more, nevermind then lol.I requested another withdraw and noticed this:"There is no fees for withdraw"Not sure how to add a picture to this thread

comments.author: Potato Chips
comments.body: Quote from: ji31 on September 05, 2022, 09:16:56 PMI requested another withdraw and noticed this:"There is no fees for withdraw"Not sure how to add a picture to this threadIt's likely to be a big lie but I see no harm in trying provided that you don't give them any cent or additional personal information.For the photo/s, you can use any image hosting service like imgur.com and paste the link in your post.
